comment: I don't know why there's all the low ratings. She gets grades back quicker than some others I've had. If you pay attention and look at feedback, you'll do well. She's very open to talking one-on-one and will work with you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I don't know why she is rated so low. Maybe students are mad about their grades. Read instructions and follow them and you will make a good grade. Our class always got grades back in a reasonable amount of time, always before the next assignment so we could read her very detailed feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This teacher will grade hard on papers and assignments. I asked for help and instead i received rude comments on my work. I second guessed all of my work and ended up with the worst grade I've had since I began online school.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This class really had no direction.  Even though it's online, you have to be committed to 1)  meeting virtually online in class presentations, 2) having to meet virtually online with your team.  There is not clear direction in group projectspresentations.  Most grades were not updated until after the final day of class.

For a class in Organizational Communication, it is neither organized nor Communicative.  We spent more class time talking about the confusing 40 page syllabus than actual content.  She said she was just given this class right before it started so didn't have time to review someone else's syllabus. Looks like this is at least the second semester. Hm

After reading all the feedback below, I was hesitant to take this class with her. But now, I wish I would have listened. She did not post grades throughout the semester and she followed another professors syllabus so any questions you had, she could not clearly answer them! If at all possible, take another professor.

As previously stated this was very confusing and syllabus was almost 40 pages long and didn't have due dates. The professor did not post grades until last week of semester, there was no way to measure progress. There are mandatory online class meetings, which defeats the purpose flexiblitly with the online class.  RUN!! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Very confusing! As the other post stated she did not post grades until the last week.  Class requires online meetings which defeates the purpose of flexablity of the online class. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Consider yourself warned

Very frustrating class. She expects you to always refer to the syllabus which was 20 pages long and all of her instructions are very vague in content. She also did not post the majority of the grades until the last day of the semester so I had no idea what my status was in the class. Stay away if possible.

The most confusing class I have ever taken.  Syllabus was almost 40 pages long and didn't even have due dates.  She did not start posting grades until last week of semester so we had no time to improve.  I worked really hard in this class and do not feel her grading reflects that.
